Identifying Characteristics: Taxinomically identical to native Golden Shiner. A key distinction between these two minnows is the phyangeal teeth
Rudd has two rows of phyrangeal teeth – 3 inner and 6 outer teeth
Golden Shiner has one row of phyrangeal teeth – 5 outer teeth
Rudd can also grow twice the size of a Golden Shiner, reaching lengths of 20 inches
Scales on belly keel between pelvic and anal fins
Biology: Spawn from spring through late summer
Range: Range: Native to Europe; introduced to North America
Northeast Range: Maine, Vermont, Massachusetts, New York
